name: inheritable
content:
inheritable adjective
(FROM DEAD PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
law
  specialized If money, a house, a title, etc. is inheritable, you can give it to someone to use after you have died: She left all of her inheritable property to her granddaughter. The court decided that the estate was not inheritable according to French law. The title of Princess of Wales is not inheritable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe lease on the property is renewable and inheritable. Fortunately, my father's debts were not inheritable.

inheritable adjective
(CHARACTERISTIC)
If a physical or mental characteristic that you have is inheritable, your children or grandchildren can be born with it as well: Eye colour is considered to be an inheritable characteristic. Both of her children were born with an inheritable blood disorder.
More examplesFewer examplesThe doctors ran a series of tests for serious inheritable diseases.A number of inheritable diseases occur in my family.Coat colour is a highly inheritable trait in cattle.
